channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-20656] Sensible defaults: Map aggregation memory configs are too aggressive
item.description:
The defaults for the following configs seems to be too aggressive. In java this can easily lead to several full GC pauses whose memory cannot be reclaimed.

HIVEMAPAGGRHASHMEMORY("hive.map.aggr.hash.percentmemory", (float) 0.99,
    "Portion of total memory to be used by map-side group aggregation hash table"),
HIVEMAPAGGRMEMORYTHRESHOLD("hive.map.aggr.hash.force.flush.memory.threshold", (float) 0.9,
    "The max memory to be used by map-side group aggregation hash table.\n" +
    "If the memory usage is higher than this number, force to flush data"),

 

We can be little bit conservative for these configs to avoid getting into GC pause.
item.summary: Sensible defaults: Map aggregation memory configs are too aggressive

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: ashutoshc gopalv ndembla any thoughts on changing the defaults for these configs?
The config seems to be changed by HIVE-20364

HIVE-20364 changed the wrong config - the comment says 

Update default for hive.map.aggr.hash.min.reduction

the actual config changed was

-    HIVEMAPAGGRHASHMEMORY("hive.map.aggr.hash.percentmemory", (float) 0.5,
+    HIVEMAPAGGRHASHMEMORY("hive.map.aggr.hash.percentmemory", (float) 0.99,

The mem thresholds are good at 0.5 - the GC pauses start to really trouble us at 80%, the tez buffers are approx ~30%, so 50% is a good enough high watermark.

LGTM - +1 tests pending

Maybe do the thing that HIVE-20364 was actually supposed to do?
Sorry about that. I will reopen HIVE-20364 and update correct config there.
This patch already does now, I think we can just wipe over that.

+1 overall
